snippet: The success of Israel’s Iron Dome antirocket missile system has had an impact on the recent outbreak of hostilities with the Palestinians.
abstract: Cross-border fighting between Israel and Palestinian militant groups in Gaza continues for fourth day; Palestinian death toll is rising from Israeli airstrikes and the militants' rockets reach farther into Israel; neither Israel nor Hamas, Islamic militant group that rules Gaza, give sign they want an all-out confrontation.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza. Rina Castelnuovo contributed reporting from Ashdod, Israel.

lead_paragraph: The success of Israel’s Iron Dome antirocket missile system has had an impact on the recent outbreak of hostilities with the Palestinians.

headline.seo: In Gaza, New Conditions Shape Old Fight
headline.main: As Rockets Fly, New Conditions Shape Fight in Gaza
headline.print_headline: In Gaza, Fight Is Familiar, but Conditions Have Changed
